definitions.definition: something that is known to have happened or to exist, especially something for which proof exists, or about which there is information:
examples: No decision will be made until we know all the facts.

definitions.definition: used to add emphasis to what you are saying, or to show that it is the opposite of or different from what went before:
examples: I don't work. In fact, I've never had a job.

definitions.definition: something unpleasant that cannot be avoided:
examples: Going bald is just a fact of life.
We are getting some facts and figures together and we will then have a full board meeting.

definitions.definition: details about sexual activity and the way that babies are born
